channel.title: Err:11 https://deb.whonix.org buster InRelease - signatures couldn't be verified because the public key is not available:
channel.description:
Looks like it's broken again, running `sudo apt update` shows
``` Err:11 https://deb.whonix.org buster InRelease The following signatures couldn't be verified because the public key is not available: NO_PUBKEY CB8D50BB77BB3C48 ```

item.title: Err:11 https://deb.whonix.org buster InRelease - signatures couldn't be verified because the public key is not available:
item.dc:creator: TNT_BOM_BOM
item.description:
Just tested this now, working perfectly on debian 11, Following this instructions: (in case you followed other)

GitLab

Whonix / monero-gui · GitLab

Monero GUI and CLI Debian Package. Can be installed using APT. Upstream / origin is https://github.com/monero-project/monero-gui.

item.title: Err:11 https://deb.whonix.org buster InRelease - signatures couldn't be verified because the public key is not available:
item.dc:creator: dginovker
item.description:
Strange, this is my host OS and it’s working fine otherwise. Only thing that might be off is I’m in an uncommon timezone, but doubt that’s it.

If I get any more info, I’ll update the thread and ping you.

item.source: Err:11 https://deb.whonix.org buster InRelease - signatures couldn't be verified because the public key is not available:

item.title: Err:11 https://deb.whonix.org buster InRelease - signatures couldn't be verified because the public key is not available:
item.dc:creator: dginovker
item.description:
Thanks for the link. I’m not using Whonix, only using their repo to get the Monero software.

I’ve updated my /etc/apt/sources.list.d/whonix.list file to look like the following (changed buster to bullseye, which I got from the Debian Releases page):

deb https://deb.whonix.org bullseye main contrib non-free

But sudo apt update is still showing a similar message:

Get:19 https://deb.whonix.org bullseye InRelease [39.6 kB]
Err:19 https://deb.whonix.org bullseye InRelease                                               
  The following signatures couldn't be verified because the public key is not available: NO_PUBKEY CB8D50BB77BB3C48
W: GPG error: https://deb.whonix.org bullseye InRelease: The following signatures couldn't be verified because the public key is not available: NO_PUBKEY CB8D50BB77BB3C48
E: The repository 'https://deb.whonix.org bullseye InRelease' is not signed.
N: Updating from such a repository can't be done securely, and is therefore disabled by default.
N: See apt-secure(8) manpage for repository creation and user configuration details.

Any idea what might be going wrong? While I’m at it, is there anything I can use for my whonix.list source so that I don’t need to update it when Whonix gets a major release as well?

Thanks,
dginovker

Read full topic
item.source: Err:11 https://deb.whonix.org buster InRelease - signatures couldn't be verified because the public key is not available:

item.title: Err:11 https://deb.whonix.org buster InRelease - signatures couldn't be verified because the public key is not available:
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
dginovker:

buster

This is different from sudo apt update - "NO_PUBKEY CB8D50BB77BB3C48".

Whonix 15 / buster based Whonix is has been deprecated.

Whonix – 17 Feb 22

Follow Whonix ™ Developments

It is absolutely crucial to subscribe to and read the latest Whonix ™ news category 'important-news' to stay in touch with ongoing developments. This way users benefit from notifications concerning important security advisories, potential upgrade...

Whonix 15 End of Security Support and Deprecation Notice - All users should move to Whonix 16! News
As per Whonix Support Schedule, this post serves as Whonix version 15 deprecation notice. Whonix 16 stable has been released for all platforms. Qubes-Whonix 16 has been Released! (Debian 11 bullseye based) - Major Release Whonix 16 has been Released! (Debian 11 bullseye based) - for VirtualBox - Major Release / Whonix 16.0.3.1 - for VirtualBox - Point Release! Whonix 16.0.2.7 KVM (Debian 11 bullseye based) - Major Stable Release Whonix 15 will be deprecated on 14 November 2021. All users …

Read full topic
